page.title: 10COMMUTER FAMILY
page.content: Mr Lloyd-Kitchen's HOMELIFE contrasts greatly with his work life in London.The family have lived in their 400 year old house in St. Margaret's for 5 years. The peaceful village has only one CHANGE since they moved there,that is the establishment of a Buddhist monastery a year ago,in place of a school for backward infants Mr Lloyd_Kitchen is a CHURCH warden and the family attends church regularly. One problem with the village,Mrs Lloyd-Kitchen felt,was the lack of TRANSPORT. They have two cars in regular use and Mrs Lloyd-Kitchen could not live without them. Their two daughters,aged 13 & 15 catch the only two buses from the village to & from school & have to be driven to the youth club in Berkhamsted for their main source of RECREATION.
